alert.note: Alert for Marinette (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 7:53PM CDT until further notice by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Green Bay WI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Pike River near Amberg affecting Marinette County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Pike River near Amberg. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, Which is flood stage...flooding affects are mainly confined to areas west of Amberg along Highway V. Between 6.5 feet and 8.0 feet...water covers an adjacent park near the the Highway V bridge. A foot bridge near the bridge may be under several feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CDT Thursday was 6.9 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.9 feet on 04/18/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning.
